The Bone Snatcher is about a group miners who go on a search for a missing crew of miners in the Namib Desert. When the find them, they do not realize that what was going on with them is solely linked to an unseen and ancient phenomenon: The dust group has gotten involved with possible living fossils… They have come across kidnappings and archaeological wrongdoing as well, hence we have no real clue what’s to be had by this sand biking posse.

Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. The movie was decent produced though.
That being said, as a piece of film history it's mostly important to see how and what wrong was done and this applies again. I think everyone should know at least one film from every era of the history with regards to production.
